column4: Hi, I'm running a dual core CPU and think I have installed 64-bit LTS OS with SNP kernel..but can anyone confirm a) i'm 64-bit and b) I'm SNP kernel from my uname output: Linux server 2.6.24-19-generic #1 SMP Wed Aug 20 22:56:21 UTC 2008 i686 GNU/Linux
so does that mean the CPU's both cores are enabled in Ubuntu and working?
i just need to install 64bit version now to get best performance?
I wasn't sure if it was working or not
will 64bit be a big performance improvement, i was a bit disappointed with this sys as it seemed to run very slow, slower than my old single core
deopends on the task. i find video reencioding much faster
i use 64bit on all my machines now.
has explained it better than I did
you can try mouseing over to where its 'at' and hold down the alt key, click , and hopefully grab the window and move it to the other monitor. :)
or try right clicking on it in the task manager panel thing, and min/max/move/resize it.
